Robotics Tutorials Network

  • Our Sites
Learn More

We teach you the building blocks of
creating and programming robots

We started as a FIRST LEGO team, became MINDSTORMS experts, won FIRST World Championships and are now a FIRST Robotics Competition Team. We supporting hundreds of thousands of students globally with our tutorials and outreach.

EV3 Tutorials
 Founded in 2014

Originally called EV3Lessons, this is the premier website for students to program with LEGO MINDSTORMS EV3. With 400,000 users in 175 countries, we have been instrumental in helping FIRST teams and MINDSTORMS users around the world. Our lessons are used by school districts, scouts, robotics clubs and teams.

FLL Tutorials
 Founded in 2018

All things FIRST LEGO League created by the World Champion's team. We provide tutorials on all parts of FIRST LEGO League. We never solve the challenge. We only provide tips for success.

Spike Tutorials
Coming Soon in 2019

Programming lessons and project ideas for SPIKE Prime created by members of the First 5 - five community members who provided input for this product.

Droids Robotics
Founded in 2018

Learn about the history of the FIRST team behind Robotics Tutorials Network. Not the Droids You Are Looking For has won a FIRST LEGO League Champion's Award at State Level every year of competing. They were the 2018 Champion's team from World Festival. Now they are a FIRST Robotics Competition Team.

Share and Learn
Founded in 2017

A collection of four Facebook Community Groups created to support teams in all four FIRST programs. These groups have brought together team members, coaches, mentors, volunteers, organizers, LEGO Education and FIRST employees. We have built a safe community where we can learn from each other.

Spotlight

Here are some of the annual outreach work we do for the FIRST community. We impact over 400,000 students globally through school districts and teams that use our lessons to robotics teams we mentor to events in the community designed to grow STEM and robotics.

  • FIRST LEGO League Kickoff

    Since 2014, we have organized and hosted the kickoff for the region. It is now an official event for the region. We bring over 250 students together at the start of the season.

  • Scoring Tools

    The scoring tools we create for teams every year are used by thousands of teams globally and even at some official competitions.

  • FIRST LEGO League Qualifier

    Since 2018, we have been organizing and hosting our very own FIRST LEGO League qualifier event. Last year, it was in collaboration with a Boys & Girls Club.

  • FIRST Volunteering

    Every year we volunteer to judge at our FIRST LEGO League State Championship impacting over 700 students. We also travel to other states to speak to and help FIRST students. We have run workshops in Ohio, Virginia, North Carolina, and Pennsylvania. We have also been part of FIRST Launch in Florida.

  • FIRST Commnity Building

    We have built FIRST commnities, bringing teams together from all over the world. This includes our work with EV3Lessons where we collaborate with over 40 teams to create lessons and resources in over a dozen languages. We also run the Share and Learn Facebook Commnities which now have over 4000 members.

  • Coming Soon

LEGO Robotics Community

We are actively involved in the LEGO Robotics community and named the youngest two MINDSTORMS Community Partners in 2017. We have travelled to many events including Maker Fairs, LEGOWORLD Copenhagen and FIRST Innovation Faire to inspire other students. We were featured in the 20th Anniversary of MINDSTORMS exhbit in Billund, Denmark as well as the official anniversary video as a result of our contributions to the community.
